data.title: Add the ability to Listen to Events on pure Script Classes
"urho3d.h" not found
data.body:
Hi,
Trying to build urho3D on Ubuntu i got the following error:

Unable to find "urho3d.h". For example in Source/Engine/Container/LinkedList.h there is a include to the "Urho3d.h". Looking at the files in the repository, I see no such file. Is this supposed to be some kind of file generated during the build or I missed something ?

Edit: I saw there is indeed a Urho3D.h in the build directory. Still I don't know why the compiler didn't find it then.

Thanks,

codec-abc

data.title: Invocation of CMake build script should not cause LuaScript to rebuild unnecessarily
data.body: The rebuild of LuaScript target in turn causes rebuild of Urho3D engine library target and all targets that depend on the engine library target unnecessarily.

data.title: tooltip style
data.body:
I tried to match the style closer to the default style.

![fullscreen_12_29_13__7_27_pm-2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/105460/1820541/abd13650-70f1-11e3-8601-120d70a2f847.png)

Thanks \m/
Chris

data.title: Add Lua binding to Skeleton::GetBone(String& name) for getting a bone by name.
Add the ability to specify an offset position for the ToolTip UI Element
data.body: Minor change that will allow you to specify the offset from the parent's screen position when displaying a tooltip.

data.title: ListView selection isn't highlighted programmatically
data.body:
If you select a ListView item via the api like this

```
listView.selection = 0
```

The item is not highlighted visually.  It does trigger the change event though.

data.title: secondary left sidebar
data.body:
implemented #92

made some minor adjustments to the rest of the UI so things were positioned a little better.

Tool tips will help if/when that gets merged in.

data.title: Small toolbar with component buttons
Add a Tooltip UI Element
Create or Set Window Borderless and Maximize/Minimize Window
data.body:
Several things this time, the first allows you to explicitly state whether a window should be borderless (no window decoration) which has mutual exclusivity with both fullscreen and resizable. It cannot be resizable because a border is required for that and it can't be fullscreen because otherwise SDL sets the window in such a way it removes the point in being a borderless window. The default setting if no width or height is passed in is desktop resolution.

The second change is the ability to Maximize a window via code instead of needing to be resizable to do so. This also includes a change so that if width or height are 0 0 the window is maximized as the default (the old default of 1024 768 has been preserved for when a user un-maximizes a window).

data.title: Click events getting swallowed by listview
data.body: it's probably by design but i am trying to add a right click context menu to a listview item click and the event isn't firing.  i think it gets swallowed internally and it doesn't propagate to the event system.

data.title: String::EMPTY and String("") do not evaluate to the same.
Recent shader change broke my shaders.
data.body:
The recent shader change, adding emissive and/or AO channels, has broken all the shaders in my game.

![screen_2013_12_23_15_7_11](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5596061/1803503/69388e96-6c1f-11e3-9b83-ec2fec2215f8.png)

Not sure exactly what's going on, since I don't get any errors logged. I'm running on fairly modest hardware (Radeon HD 6530D) but haven't had any issues until now. I get the same problem running the game at work on older integrated Intel boxes with XP that only support SM2. All materials are either Diff, DiffNormal or DiffAlphaMask techniques, using unmodified shaders. Here is the log, indicating that no errors occur during shader creation.

data.title: Add FindNearestPoint() to NavigationMesh class and expose it to script i...
data.body:
...nterfaces.

When path following without physics, it is useful to be able to adhere tightly to the mesh in order to avoid the magical floaties when coming down or going up ramps.

data.title: Modification of Resourece Directory and Package File search priority for GetFile and GetResource
data.body:
Currently GetFile and subsequently GetResource assume two things, that package files want to be searched first and that Resource Directories are always to be searched in the order that they are added. This is less true for Package files, since you can specify to add them to the front of the vector instead.

What I propose is two fold. First there is a function similar to the following:

```
GetSubsystem<ResourceCache>()->SetSearchPackagesFirst(true);
```

Which when calling GetFile or GetResource will use that flag to define which locations to search first, the default behaviour for this will be packages first.

Secondly there is the ability to define the priority of resource directories and package files in this search process. To facilitate this a modification should be made with more granularity than Front or Back that will work along the following lines:

```
GetSubsystem<ResourceCache>()->AddResourceDirectory("Dir");
GetSubsystem<ResourceCache>()->AddResourceDirectory("Dir",3);
```

Where the first would default to the end of the list, and the second would be placed in the "4" spot in the list or at the end if the list is not that big.

---

I'm not totally sure whether this is suitable for widespread Urho, since my usage of it has some requirements for modability in my applications where mods can overwrite scripts that define certain aspects of the logic and so instead of keeping my own map of original name to overridden location I'd prefer to have the underlying resource cache able to do so for me.

data.title: Windows DPI scaling
data.body:
Crank up your dpi in windows.  I am running windows 8.1.  I have mine at 150% right now because I am near blind at the end of the day sometimes.

It looks like DPI for fonts isn't happening.  The editor windows do scale according to the dpi and the font bitmaps are for the lower dpi and get scaled fonts are generated.

How would it look if we had 150% resolution for the editor assets and downsampled to 100%?  Disabling dpi changes is a choice.  There are a couple of choices to be made but I think having everything fuzzy is one of weaker choices.  Most games do not respond to dpi changes.

data.title: Import tools should include also bones with no skinning geometry
data.body:
For purposes of attachments and skeleton sharing, bones which do not contribute to skinning should also be included in a model file's skeleton.

At the same time unwanted dummy helper nodes should be excluded, perhaps through a naming convention.

data.title: Numpad 1, 3, 7 should not change camera view when in attribute editing mode
data.body: When entering number value in the attribute inspector I reckon most of the people would use numpad.

data.title: Fix collision calculation of index offset when using multiple geometries
Ambient Ocollusion Map permutation
data.body: Add Ambient Occlusion Map permutation to shaders - it replace LightMap if we choose it.

data.title: Add Lua binding to PODVector<RayQueryResult> and Octree::Raycast()
data.body: Binding for Octree::Raycast to Lua, to allow full raycast instead of single result.

data.title: Issue with physics transform deserialization?
data.body:
Hello, I seem to be having an issue with physics deserialization.  When I load the scene, all the rigid bodies show up at identity:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/90864981/Physics1.PNG

Now, if I move the node they are attached to slightly the position pops into place, then if I rotate the node a little, the rotation pops in:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/90864981/Physics2.PNG

It seems like the transform initialization from the node position/rotation/scale isn't working when deserializing?

Thanks!
~Josh

data.title: Lua binding to Octree::Raycast()
Scene navigation improvements in the editor
data.body:
Hello,

I've made some changes which make it easier to move around the scene when using the editor.  The patch makes E and Q move up and down, as in Unity and UDK.  Following Blender, it makes the numeric keypad 1, 3, and 7 keys select front, side and top views.  (Again as in Blender, control with those keys selects the opposite viewback, left and bottom.)

I also modified the code which tracks the camera's pitch and yaw, so it doesn't gimbal lock when you are facing straight up or straight down.  Of course there is a lot of personal preference in the way mouse look works, so I'll understand if you decide you are happy with the way it is now. :)

Thank you for your time developing Urho3D, and if you'd like to include these changes, please help yourself.  I have only just started experimenting with Urho3D so it's possible I've duplicated some existing functionality, or implemented this in a way that isn't sensible.

Pete

data.title: MinGW/GCC Build fails @ Preparing merge script
data.body: Building on Windows MinGW, after the static lib is built, the build process fails when it tries to invoke 'mv' rather than 'move' to move a file. I believe the offending line comes at line 150 of Source/Engine/CMakeLists.txt. This line is inside a control block starting at Line 146 with the conditional if (NOT APPLE AND NOT MSVC) which results in cmake thinking that a MinGW build is a *nix build and trying to invoke mv instead of move as it should.

data.title: Allow Getting and Setting of Inner XML Text
data.body:
I noticed when creating a settings file in xml and using the XML api, that there was no way to retrieve the inner text when a node was in the form.

```
<node>text</node> 
```

This adds that functionality as well as adding the ability to create an XMLElement in that format. It only adds getting for Lua though since unlike angelscript it doesn't seem to have the ability to use the Set functions for XML. Functionality works like follows:

```
String text = root.GetChild("node").GetValue();
root.CreateChild("node").SetValue("text");
```

There was one possible change I was toying with in the Set function in that perhaps it should ensure that no other child nodes have been added before allowing the call to succeed.

data.title: Window icon
data.body:
Adds in the cross platform ability of SDL to set an Icon for the Window and Taskbar (On suitable OSes) as well as exposing it to the scripting API.

Please let me know if you'd like any changes to it to make it more suitable.
